messages.subject: Mother's Day Idea
messages.msgSnippet: Click here: Homeschooling Reflections/book/unschooling/5 kids learn at home for 20+years Hi, I was at a
messages.messageBody:
<A HREF="http://www.homeschoolingreflections.com/">Click here: Homeschooling Reflections/book/unschooling/5 kids learn at home
for 20+years</A>

Hi,

I was at a friend's house, and she decided to buy my book to give as a gift
to her Mom for Mother's Day (which is May 9th). We thought that was a great
idea.

I have some reusable cloth gift bags from an early business venture, so if
you order a book for Mother's Day, write Mother's Day in the business line of
the order form, and I'll put in a gift bag with the book for wrapping (or send
it wrapped to the mom- send an e-mail to let me know).

If you no longer have your mom available to "gift" perhaps you'd like to
donate a copy of HOMESCHOOLING REFLECTIONS to your local library as a gift to
other moms. You can send me an e-mail to that effect, after placing your order,
and I can send it to the library you specify, with a donation notation in the
book if you'd like.

Or, if you'd like to receive the book as a gift, send this e-mail on to the
person/people that "gift" you on that day!

Yours,
Connie
www.homeschoolingreflections.com

ps - feel free to pass this e-mail onto other lists if you feel the urge!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
